content.text: Traditional indexes are 1D. Multimedia data is multi-dimensional. This topic covers the spatial data structures needed to find similar media quickly.
content.hook: When text search fails, geometry takes over.

content.description: The logic of indexing high-dimensional multimedia objects.

content.text: 1. 1D Time Series: Using DFT (Discrete Fourier Transform) and R-trees. 2. 2D Color Images: Using Color Histograms and spatial trees (R-Trees, M-Trees).
outcomes: The Curse of Dimensionality: Performance drops as dimensions increase.

content.text: The computer automatically finds key indicators. 1. Vision: Edges, Blobs, Corners (SIFT, SURF). 2. Audio: Beats, MFCC. 3. Modern: Deep Embeddings from CNNs.
